content.description:
Layback and jam up the awesome finger crack to a shiny new piton. Clip that bad boy and make some awkward moves up to the tree with a sling anchor. Like most climbs in the Brighton area, you will wish it was longer.

I stumbled upon this route when checking out the area with a friend. If anyone has information on the FA, route name, or grade, please let me know. We thought it felt somewhere in the range of 5.9 or 5.9-.
content.protection: Singles .3 to 1 should be sufficient. Consider taking a #2 to protect the awkward moves above the pin.
content.location: This route can be found on the far left (furthest left?) of Walter's Wall. It should be the first route you come to.

content.description:
A fully bottomed out seam on excellent rock that doesn't take gear or fingies. Super tech climbing just under vertical. You'll be using holds smaller than would ever stick around on flakey LCC granite. When you stand on those horrible foot holds just right, it doesn't feel so bad.

Two generations of old bolts indicated previous free climbing intent, but no info beyond that. Anyone know the story?
content.location: The thin S curving seam in the center of the wall with bolts on the right side
